name: sfchronicle
text:
A Bay Area assemblyman will revise his bill requiring that mail ballots be sent to to every California voter after concerns arose that the current version could cause more problems than it would solve.

https://t.co/B92X9LxIe0

name: sfchronicle
text:
"My brother was kneeling and surrendering": Family of SF man killed by Vallejo police disputes chief’s narrative.

Story by @MeganRCassidy & @ctuan: https://t.co/QESiSNqjNE

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Hundreds of cars parade out of Golden Gate Park late Thursday afternoon to show solidarity with the recent protests.  The caravan IS scheduled to do a 10-mile loop through San Francisco. https://t.co/aSpx3VWItd

name: sfchronicle
text:
Many CVS and Walgreens locations in the Bay Area remain shuttered after some stores were vandalized and looted. 

Here's a list of the closest open stores to you (store hours vary by location so call ahead): https://t.co/sSqZIFfxJ8

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Hundreds of demonstrators fill Fernandez Park in Pinole as part of a “George Floyd Solidarity” protest. The demonstration, which was led by black and community organizers of color, is scheduled to include a march to the Pinole Police Department.  https://t.co/6BA1GH5Ni4

name: sfchronicle
text: PROTEST UPDATES: Police say “several hundred” protesters are peacefully marching down El Camino Real toward Rengstorff Avenue in Mountain View shortly after 5:30 p.m. https://t.co/MPqfTteQYL

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. Gavin Newsom says he’s concerned about the spread of coronavirus as protests against police brutality continue across the state. “If you’re not (concerned), you’re not paying attention ... to the virulence of this disease,” he said in Stockton. https://t.co/lqK7YRAI3i https://t.co/ee0G1rVT8z

name: sfchronicle
text:
Lunchtime yoga — six feet apart, of course — in front of the @calacademy colony of African penguins takes care of two birds with one pose. 

Staff gets a healthful, anxiety-reducing break, and the penguins get their “people TV” back.

https://t.co/QSKdPu6uwW

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here are several options for movies to watch to better understand this historic moment:

https://t.co/7M9r0ZhMB7

text: A car caravan protest against against the Minneapolis police killing of George Floyd turns into 6th Ave from Anza S… https://t.co/aB2FHLVFTv

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Solano County’s 8 p.m. curfew is lifted Thursday morning. Some cities in the county have curfews still in effect, including Vallejo. https://t.co/IOzXaRfieu

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: Several hundred people who congregated at Oakland City Hall begin marching up Telegraph Avenue before turning onto W. Grand Avenue. They chanted “No justice, no peace” and held cardboard signs overhead while nearby cars honked in support. https://t.co/y1sozd7mCh

name: sfchronicle
text: In Oakland, protesters chanting "No justice, no peace," march from Telegraph Ave. to West Grand Ave., against the M… https://t.co/0p7KQ7cbQI

name: sfchronicle
text: Protesters in Oakland met a line of CHP officers at 14th and Brush as they marched toward the freeway overpass. Sho… https://t.co/Z6Sw0eSToQ

name: sfchronicle
text: Another group of former Grand Princess passengers is suing Carnival Corp. and its Princess cruise line, alleging the line was aware of coronavirus infections on another ship but did not take measures to protect passengers. https://t.co/bb8I9jwW8b

name: sfchronicle
text:
San Francisco officials say they’re committed to taking a portion of the police department’s budget and redirecting it to the city’s African American community. 

https://t.co/g9w3Fs01hI

name: sfchronicle
text: The new rules “will reverse decades of effort to end the corrosive effects of sexual harassment on equal access to education,” lawyers for 17 states and the District of Columbia said in a federal court filing.  https://t.co/aNpd9B0WUS

name: sfchronicle
text: JUST IN: The city of Concord’s curfew, which police said was formed in “response to the unpredictable nature of the civil unrest in the region,” will remain in effect until Monday, June 8.  https://t.co/Yl9e8N6ZEE

name: sfchronicle
text: LUL 23 dances on Broadway in Oakland, near an ongoing protest outside City Hall. https://t.co/Y3A8cdJNDb

name: sfchronicle
text:
"This is my fight": Crowds take to streets for 7th day of Bay Area protests.

Story by @MatthewKawahara, @KurtisAlexander & @JillTucker: https://t.co/F25oBapUV6

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: The broad curfew order for Contra Costa County has been lifted, and several cities — which can institute their own curfews — quickly followed suit.  

https://t.co/bRc5yazQOY

name: sfchronicle
text:
A growing fire in San Jose’s Santa Teresa foothills — believed to be arson — is threatening homes and prompting evacuations Thursday evening, officials said.

Story by @abauman2: https://t.co/OF7nEY2jYa https://t.co/W9NGW4kjMD

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: San Francisco Police Department told The Chronicle that its officers arrested 23 people on suspicion of violating a curfew order on the 2400 block of Mission Street at 10:51 p.m. Wednesday night.

https://t.co/ZGxImXOfQK

name: sfchronicle
text: Two swimmers were rescued from the surf at Ocean Beach. One is in critical condition. https://t.co/Hj6YCy0dVa

name: sfchronicle
text:
Join Chronicle writer @JanelleBitker and Aomboon Deasy of K&J Orchards for a live video chat Tuesday, June 9 at 6:00 p.m. Hear about how the farm is adapting during the pandemic, get a peek at the orchards, and learn how you can help local farms.

https://t.co/PkB4vNQ61U

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Four Berkeley city council members called on Berkeley police to stop using tear gas, pepper spray, smoke bombs, and other chemical agents as crowd control measures, citing a concern that it could cause a spike in coronavirus cases.

https://t.co/zoH21NFSgb

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: In a Twitter thread detailing a peaceful protest and march, @MountainViewPD shared a photo of four of its officers kneeling along with protesters. In the Tweet, police wrote, “We see you. We hear you. We are here with you.”

Live updates: https://t.co/Uc0KJ0EkeB https://t.co/rXX7iaNJ9y

name: sfchronicle
text:
Gov. @GavinNewsom: California should prepare for a surge in its #coronavirus positive test rate following a week of protests against police brutality.

Story by @MusicSF: https://t.co/EauIAqIUun

name: sfchronicle
text: PROTEST UPDATES: Video shows Buffalo police officers shoving man, who falls and hits his head. The clip appears to show an older protester who encounters a phalanx of police officers, get shoved, stumbles backward and then starts bleeding from the head. https://t.co/kizWbNfjy6

name: sfchronicle
text: From columnist @otisrtaylorjr: To understand why the protests are necessary, look no further than Vallejo. https://t.co/0PCBne6ie2

name: sfchronicle
text: Saints QB Drew Brees issued an apology on Thursday for his gale of words that cut a path through the NFL, the sports landscape and the New Orleans community a day earlier. It seems inexcusable that Brees could trot out such tired words, writes @AnnKillion. https://t.co/pLHJ7xcAQW

name: sfchronicle
text:
What will school look like in the fall? And will the kids who’ve just gone through this strangest of terms be woefully behind? Education reporter @JillTucker has some reassuring words. 

Listen 🎧:
https://t.co/QBH7fjmEwq

name: sfchronicle
text:
Laugh out loud with Comedy Day Classics from Golden Gate Park — a 90-minute virtual comedy concert featuring performances from Comedy Day’s nearly 40-year history. Click here for more information.

https://t.co/ikOAWJrtpe

name: sfchronicle
text:

•  These lakes are open for camping, fishing now https://t.co/nJDZa0y6XT

name: sfchronicle
text:
Jobless aid applicants left on hold by the state, why we need more black journalists now, and beloved S.F. cafe is for sale.

Here's what you need to know to start your day: https://t.co/XNitV50jMH https://t.co/9K2UQRzG31

text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
Why SF’s new laws to force more mentally ill and addicted people into treatment haven’t been used yet.

Story by @TrishaThadani: https://t.co/hLAk8T10wS https://t.co/2ka6FS0jIW

name: sfchronicle
text:
East Bay @RepBarbaraLee talks to Chronicle political writers @joegarofoli and @talkopan about how whites can be better allies for African Americans, and who she thinks @JoeBiden should pick as a running mate.

Apple > https://t.co/MMO3lf2c2V
Spotify > https://t.co/PhQfbWaNrp https://t.co/ENd18pwZtv

name: sfchronicle
text: Unemployment dropped to 13.3% in May, suggesting the economy has passed the high point of the job devastation wrought by the #coronavirus and shelter-in-place orders. https://t.co/CYPgFdtWxm

name: sfchronicle
text: Twitter executives blocked a video tribute to George Floyd posted by President Trump's campaign over a copyright claim, the Associated Press reports. https://t.co/waIN5CRlTj

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @TalKopan: When she was a kid, .@RepBarbaraLee’s parents weren’t allowed to buy a house in San Leandro because they were black.

Now, that city is in her district. 

Her message to young people on keeping up the fight:

Apple > https://t.co/nMYiiKbgGT
Spotify > https://t.co/J6uK23YMcD

name: sfchronicle
text: Today's front page: the stories San Francisco is talking about this morning. https://t.co/sgK7iFvtYo https://t.co/t1reRrJeuJ

name: sfchronicle
text: With one of the goals of the protests being a reframing of how America sees black people, the image of Brianna Noble riding her horse through Oakland is a deeply effective symbol. https://t.co/Get4ZTGqnH

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @susanslusser: A's President Dave Kaval tells the @sfchronicle the team is close to gaining Coliseum use; short season 'makes sense' and how many games; plus a stadium update https://t.co/CiWuiOg0F9

name: sfchronicle
text: Thousands of cloth face masks that read “Stop Killing Black People” were seized by the U.S. Postal Inspection Service during shipping, according to the owner of Movement Ink, of Oakland. https://t.co/RPR8pOs5Ji https://t.co/Ka0PyBWCtr

name: sfchronicle
text:
RT @TrishaThadani: NEW: When SF expanded its conservatorship laws, the idea was to help the sickest of the sick: those who are severely mentally ill, addicted to drugs, and often cycling in and out of the hospital.

But so far, the new laws haven't been used once. Here's why https://t.co/lrSDM6mNrx

name: sfchronicle
text: UPDATE: A grass fire suspected to be caused by an arsonist was 80% contained early Friday morning in San Jose’s Santa Teresa foothills. https://t.co/lXWscisHe6

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @KathPender: 'Some constituents are in tears, weeping in the calls. They are so frustrated and upset,' said state Sen. Jerry Hill, who chairs the committee that oversees EDD. https://t.co/rFhE5KRK2U

name: sfchronicle
text: “It’s not too often you see a black woman on a horse in Oakland. I decided I’m going to give them something to look at.” https://t.co/jfYyvrc6Ms

name: sfchronicle
text: President Trump credited the use of the National Guard with tamping down chaotic protests in Minneapolis as well as other cities, and he said he’s ready to send in more troops where needed. https://t.co/saRJkS436i

name: sfchronicle
text: While the number of calls for help in California has varied, “the calls are now indicating a much greater severity of violence, much more physical violence ... strangulations,” compared with past years. https://t.co/sCFs063hl9

name: sfchronicle
text:
Should baseball return when more than 40 million Americans are out of work? When folks are trying to come to grips with the protests and pandemic, not to mention the systemic racism that has fueled the anger? 

@JohnSheaHey's column: https://t.co/T82UIg9IKi

name: sfchronicle
text: President Trump on Friday suggested George Floyd would be happy about newly released employment numbers. https://t.co/kW2cLvOTM0

name: sfchronicle
text:
Rangers opened seven trailheads this week at Point Reyes National Seashore in a wave of reopenings at parks, beaches and watersheds across the Bay Area. 

@stienstratom on what to know before you go: https://t.co/itASlmjQ5Q
